posts.post_content:
*"Have you read the flavor text carefully? It's a grammatical train wreck..."*  
-Enchurito.  
  
It's perfectly grammatical.  
  
"Izzet-designed conductors atop Sunhome..."--this is the subject.  
  
"...charge empty sets of armor..."--this explains what the conductors do.  
  
"that give form to the fluctuating elementals."--and this explains what those charged suits of armor do.  
  
Boiling it down, it says, "Conductors charge armor." What kind of conductors? Conductors that sit atop Sunhome and were designed by the Izzet. What kind of armor? Empty sets of it. What does the armor do? Give form to the elementals.  
  
Your suggestion, however, makes no sense. "Izzet-designed conductors atop Sunhome charged empty sets of armor give form to the fluctuating elementals"? The tenses of the verbs don't match--"charged" vs. "give form". There needs to be a coordinating conjunction between the clauses "charged empty sets of armor" and "give form...". You wouldn't say "Izzet-designed machines generated electric... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

"Have you read the flavor text carefully? It's a grammatical train wreck..."
-Enchurito.

It's perfectly grammatical.

"Izzet-designed conductors atop Sunhome..."--this is the subject.

"...charge empty sets of armor..."--this explains what the conductors do.

"that give form to the fluctuating elementals."--and this explains what those charged suits of armor do.

Boiling it down, it says, "Conductors charge armor." What kind of conductors? Conductors that sit atop Sunhome and were designed by the Izzet. What kind of armor? Empty sets of it. What does the armor do? Give form to the elementals.

Your suggestion, however, makes no sense. "Izzet-designed conductors atop Sunhome charged empty sets of armor give form to the fluctuating elementals"? The tenses of the verbs don't match--"charged" vs. "give form". There needs to be a coordinating conjunction between the clauses "charged empty sets of armor" and "give form...". posts.post_content:
This is scary and good!  
I like it, since I can respect that it's not quite "overpowered" (it IS super powerful, it can net a difference of 12 life in a single attack for 4cmc only), but still balanced enough to not make it frustrating (yeah, first strike and a simple ping does it for this guy)  
4.5/5 for being quite balanced

Posted By: DritzD27 (5/13/2013 2:37:07 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
[Silverblade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Silverblade), [Ajani, Caller of the Pride](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ajani, Caller of the Pride), [Boros Charm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boros Charm)...  
  
Yep, lots of ways to make this a game-ender.  
  
Honestly, if you get to the fourth turn and haven't dealt the 8 damage to make this guy lethal, you're playing the deck wrong.  
  
T1: [Vexing Devil](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vexing Devil) smashes them for four  
T2: [Boros Charm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boros Charm), same thing  
T3: [Silverblade Paladin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Silverblade Paladin) or [Ajani, Caller of the Pride](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ajani, Caller of the Pride)  
T4: Lethal Spark Trooper.
posts.html:
Silverblade, Ajani, Caller of the Pride, Boros Charm...

Yep, lots of ways to make this a game-ender.

Honestly, if you get to the fourth turn and haven't dealt the 8 damage to make this guy lethal, you're playing the deck wrong.

T1: Vexing Devil smashes them for four
T2: Boros Charm, same thing
T3: Silverblade Paladin or Ajani, Caller of the Pride
T4: Lethal Spark Trooper.

If aggro mirror becomes the main thing, this might be good enough to see play.  
  
Once [Hellrider](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hellrider) rotates, these are the curve toppers we have for RDW:  
  
[Exava](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Exava)  
[Burning Earth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Burning Earth)  
[Chandra, Pyromaster](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chandra, Pyromaster)  
this  
  
Against aggro, this seems to be the best of the bunch.

[Ball Lightning](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ball Lightning) with lifelink. While Ball Lightning might be better overall, the one mana for lifelink was a decent tradeoff as lifelink becomes more valuable of an ability the higher the power of the creature is.  
  
This is a very decent card in Boros.  
  
4/5
